Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is partially light-brown in section, the interior is spotted with an off-white deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394621) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394621)
